answers.answer: Have you ever been tested to know your own hsv status?A headache and sore jaw aren't specifically signs of oral herpes.grace

No, I've never been tested in the past but once I found out she gets them, I went and got a blood test right away.I thought maybe the sore jaw was considered "swollen lymph nodes" which is a characteristic of hsv-1...isn't it?

I think you are really having a lot of anxiety about this and have convinced yourself that you have to have contracted hsv1 orally?  Lesions on the corners of the lips might not even be hsv1 orally either. Has your partner been tested to know her status?did you get your test results back?If you really are worried about this, go and be seen. The fact that you are a diabetic isn't an issue for this.grace

The doctor looked at her lips and prescribed some sort of cold sore medicine without administering a blood test.No, I didn't get the test results back yet...I called today and they said I would get them back next week (they're sent to public health?)I also had a pimple like bump appear on the top of my lip.  What would the initial stages of it look like ?

question: Hi,I would just like to thank you in advance for having this great site available and helping me.I was kissed by my girlfriend who has HSV-1 and was unaware she had it.  This would be the 5th night of not having any bumps/spots show up yet.  It was not a full blown soar on her lip when we kissed but still a bump underneath the skin.  She claims when we kissed that I never touched it.(since it's on the corner of her mouth)I've been having a headache (I never get headaches) and my jaw is sore.  I'm not sure if this is because of lack of sleep i've been getting from stress or if i'm actually going to get a sore very soon.My question is:1 - Do these symptoms relate to HSV-1 although i do not feel any pain or bumps yet.2 - If i do get cold sores, will they be worse for me and am i more prone to them seeing as I have type 1 diabetesThank you so much for your help
title: HSV-1
